moves.5. Qa4+: ...but as there's no way of saving it...
moves.6... Qd4: Now I bring up my queen to pressurise my opponent's...
moves.8... gxf6: ...but take his bishop, distorting my pawn structure.
moves.9. O-O-O Bh6+: However, the hole allows me to unleash my bishop...
moves.11. Nf3: After he brings up his knight...
moves.11... Bg4: ...I unleash my other bishop to pressurise it, potentially along with his rook...
moves.12. Be2: ...but he brings up his own to cover.
moves.12... Na6: Now I bring up my other knight to free my queenside rook...
moves.13. a3: ...but he covers the b4 square with his pawn...
moves.14... Rad8: Now I bring out a rook to contest the open d-file...
moves.15. Rxd8 Rxd8: ...and we exchange, and now I have control of the file.
moves.16. Rd1: He brings his other rook to contest...
moves.17... Nc5: Now I put my knight on the attack...
moves.18. Bg4: ...and he eyes up my bottom rank with his bishop...
moves.18... Nd3: ...so I attack two pawns at once with my knight...
moves.20. c5: He moves his c-pawn away from my knight...
moves.20... b6: ...but I attack it with my b-pawn...
moves.21. cxb6 axb6: ...and we swap, creating yet more space.
moves.23. Bb5 f5: I move my f6-pawn to give my f7-pawn room to manoeuvre, and to help my e-pawn.
moves.24. Na4 Nxa4 25. Bxa4: Now we swap knights, leaving another bishop and pawn ending.
moves.26... Bf8: ...so I retreat my bishop to eye up his a-pawn, but my c-pawn is blocking its path...
moves.28... Bxa3: ...but I manage to remove his far left-hand pawn, obliterating his queenside.
moves.29... Bb2: ...so I bring up the bishop to cover its neighbour.
moves.30. h4 Kg7: I move up my king to cover my h7- and f7-pawns...
...allows me to undouble my f-pawns, and create a passed pawn, for a possible promotion.
moves.32. Kf1 Bd4: Now my bishop moves in to help out...
moves.36. exf5+ Kxf5: ...and get the exchange, freeing up mine, and allowing me to pressurise his f-pawn.
moves.37. Be2: Although the bishop gets back to cover...
moves.37... Kf4: ...I bring up my king to potentially pressurise both.
moves.39. Bxh7: ...and although I lose my far left...
moves.39... g2: ...my second left is on course for promotion, and should he check with my bishop 40. Be4+, I could capture the bishop 40... Kxe4, and if I do lose my pawn 41. Kxg2, I can remove his 41... Bxh4, and I have backup.
